svcproc.title: Operation of Diamond Logic™ Engine Brake in Braking Mode

figure.caption: Brake shutoff valve and brake actuator- ON

calloutgroup.callout1: High-pressure oil flow to brake oil gallery

svcproc.para: The ECM monitors the following criteria to make sure certain conditions are met.

item.para: Operator input switches (On/Off) (power selection - Low, Med, High)

svcproc.para: If On is selected, and the above criteria is met, the engine brake will activate.

When the engine brake is activated, the ECM provides the ground to activate the brake shutoff valve to allow oil from the injector oil gallery to flow to the brake oil gallery. High oil pressure activates the brake actuator pistons to open the exhaust valves.
During an ABS event, the engine brake is deactivated. The engine brake is activated once the ABS event is over.

figure.caption: Brake pressure relief valve in high-pressure oil rail

svcproc.para: The ECM removes the ground source from the brake shutoff valve to deactivate the engine brake. Residual brake gallery pressure initially bleeds from the actuator bore. When brake gallery pressure reaches 1000 psi, the brake pressure relief valve opens, and oil drains back to sump.
